Key Match Events: Bobby Portis delivered his best performance of the season, tallying 21 points and a massive 18 rebounds
Damian Lillard showcased his scoring prowess, putting up 36 points along with seven assists
Pre-Game Insights: Without their best player, Giannis Antetokounmpo, the Bucks managed to keep it competitive against the undefeated Cavaliers
Milwaukee is still missing a key player, Khris Middleton, whose return date remains uncertain
Post-Match Reflections: Had they avoided a few key mistakes, like a costly half-court violation that led to a Darius Garland three-pointer in the final seconds, the Bucks might have come away with a win
With 75 games still left, thereâ€™s plenty of time to regain their form
The Bucks have not had an easy start, playing five of their first seven games on the road
Eight of their next ten games will be at home, which could give them the boost they need to reset and gain some momentum
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Bucks suffered their sixth consecutive loss and have now dropped to 1-6
The Bucks return to Fiserv Forum to face the struggling Utah Jazz, a game that offers an opportunity to get back on track
